body: In noncyclic electron flow, what is the final electron acceptor of Photosystem 1?
Which of the following least accurately describes archaea?

choices.W: Their cell membranes are phospholipid monolayers
choices.X: Fatty acids in their cell membranes are linked with ester bonds
choices.Y: They are more tolerant to high salinity than most eubacteria

body: Which of the following 3 statements is true about Antarctic Bottom Water, or AABW? 1) Temperatures range from -4 to -0.5 degrees C; 2) It is formed from surface water cooling in polynyas and near the ice shelf; 3) Recent climate change and consequent melting of the Antarctic ice sheet has slowed the formation of AABW.
What is the primary mechanism that removes star forming gas from a galaxy when it moves towards the center of a galaxy cluster?
A 5 kg box moving at 4 m/s collides inelastically with a stationary 3 kg box. What is the final velocity of the boxes?

A 3 cubic meter block is submerged half in oil and half in water, and is in static equilibrium. If the density of water is $1000 \athrm{kg} / \athrm{m}^3$ and the density of oil is $800 \athrm{kg} / \athrm{m}^3$, what is the mass of the block?
A string of 3 letters, each letter being A or B is randomly chosen. What is the probability of having more B's than A's in the string?
Which of the following best describes the Euclidean Algorithm for finding the greatest common divisor of two numbers?

choices.W: Prime factorize each of the numbers and pick the primes out
choices.X: Multiply both of the numbers and divide by the least common multiple
choices.Y: Using remainders by dividing the larger by the smaller and repeating
choices.Z: Multiply both the numbers and divide by their difference

body: Which of the following is true about solid solutions? 1) The exsolution of solid solutions forms lamellae that are characterized by differing cation size; 2) The lowest melting of a solid solution is usually near an endmember; 3) The Hume-Rothery rules govern the formation of solid solutions based on similar electronegativities and atomic radii.
Which of the following is true about the addition of oxygen to a Grignard reagent? 1) radical intermediates are formed; 2) a magnesium organoperoxide is formed; 3) the halide is removed as an anion
What bond links the phosphates of an ATP molecule?
What class of noncoding RNAs are utilized in CRISPR systems to guide the endonuclease complex to the target sequence?
Which of the following igneous structures is a small batholith-like discordant intrusion?
Order the following minerals in terms of increasing relative stability at standard temperature and pressure: 1) vermiculite; 2) magnesioowustite; 3) sillimanite; 4) andalusite
Which fundamental force violates charge parity?

A hollow, air cored inductor coil consists of 200 turns of copper wire, which produces a magnetic flux of 6 milliwebers when passing a DC current of 10 amps. Calculate the self-inductance of the coil in milli-Henries.
What is the period of the function $f(x) = \in^2 (x) * \os^2 (x)$?
What is the area between the curves $y = x^3$ and $y = x + 2$ between $x = 0$ and $x = 1$?
Which of the following cations is the most stable?
What important metal oxide is used to oxidize alkenes into vic diols, also used as a staining agent in TEM to provide contrast to the image?
PIN Proteins in plants are associated with the transport of what major plant hormone?
The first step of the Calvin cycle, catalyzed by Rubisco, forms what molecule?
Which of the following minerals cannot be mined as a source of copper?

Which of the following statements about important angles in structural geology is true? 1) true dip is always greater than apparent dip; 2) trend is equal to strike if the ground surface is parallel to the horizontal plane; 3) plunge is measured along the limb of a fold
When a free neutron decays into a proton via beta minus decay, what particle mediates the flavor change from the down quark into an up quark?

A particular planet has mass $7.0 \times 10^{23} \athrm{kg}$ and a radius of $2.0 \times 10^{6} \athrm{m}$. What is the escape velocity, in meters per second, on this planet? Take $G$ to be $7 \times 10^{-11} \athrm{Nm}^{2} \athrm{kg}^{-2}$
Which of the following is equivalent to $\osh(2x)$?
What is the sum of the values in the matrix that results from the multiplication of a 2 by 3 matrix with all values being 6 and a 3 by 2 matrix with all values being 7?
What quantity describes useful work obtained from a closed isothermal and isochoric system?
Even as aromatic rings are interrupted by an sp3 carbon atom, they can still maintain aromaticity through what mechanism, seen in molecules like $\athrm{C}_8\athrm{H}_9^+$?
Which of the following gives myelin its characteristic white color?
What oval-shaped mechanoreceptor is located in the Stratum basale of the skin and is essential for light touch sensation?
The phase transition of spinel structured ringwoodite into the denser perovskite phases of magnesioowustite and bridgmanite occurs at which of the following depths?
In stars above 0.3 solar masses, what is the transition layer between the radiative zone and convective zone, representing significant rotational shear between the two layers?
An ideal refrigerator is operating between temperatures of 27 degrees celsius and 77 degrees celsius. What is the coefficient of performance of this refrigerator?
A ball with moment of inertia $(2 / 5)\athrm{mr}^2$ rolls down a 30 degree inclined plane. What is its acceleration?
5 students are sitting at a round table. How many seatings are possible if rotations are indistinct?
What is the area of a triangle with side lengths of 13, 14, and 15?
Which of the following solids has a zincblende structure?
Assuming there are no rings or triple bonds, how many double bonds are present in the molecule $\athrm{C}_{12}\athrm{H}_{15}\athrm{O}_{2}\athrm{Cl}$?
